Prompt:
The study of older adults and aging is referred to as

A) Gerontology
B) Geropsychiatry
C) Geriatrics
D) Gero-education

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following factors is associated with a decreased risk of Alzheimer's?

A) Being African or Hispanic American
B) Eating fish
C) A lower level of education
D) Being married

Please select the correct answer.

The docility hypothesis is that

A) Those with low capabilities are more vulnerable to environmental demands
B) Those who experience high environmental demands become more docile
C) Those who experience high environmental demands become less docile
D) Those with less capability are less vulnerable to environmental demands

Please select the correct answer.

Normal memory seems to be improved by

A) Aerobic exercise
B) Taking acetylcholine
C) Taking gingko
D) Increasing social contacts

Please select the correct answer.

The perspective that development is embedded in history means that

A) Change can always occur regardless of age
B) Sociocultural conditions must always be considered
C) Development in any particular areas (e.g., social) is tied to development in other areas (e.g., cognitive)
D) Some characteristics change with age while others do not

Please select the correct answer.

The answer "both play an important role" is clearly applicable to the question of

A) Nature vs. nurture
B) Mechanistic vs organismic
C) Continuity vs. discontinuity
D) All of these questions

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following does NOT usually occur to the lens of the eye as one grows older?

A) It becomes thicker
B) It yellows
C) It becomes clouded
D) It fills with fluid

Please select the correct answer.

The houses of the future may allow you to operate virtually everything in the house from a central terminal; such a house is already in production and is referred to as

A) Technohouse
B) Compuhouse
C) Futurehouse
D) Smarthouse

Please select the correct answer.

The reaction time difference between younger and older adults is reduced when older adults

A) Practice regular aerobic exercise
B) Lift weights on a regular schedule
C) Consume large quantities of vitamins
D) Practice Tai chi

Please select the correct answer.

A major difference between programmed and unprogrammed theories of senescence is that programmed theories

A) Attribute senescence only to environmental factors
B) Are far too difficulty to test
C) Claim that senescence follows a predetermined plan
D) Rely too heavily on computer models

Please select the correct answer.

One reason that older adults show high levels of optimism is that

A) Many pessimists die at a younger age
B) They do not really know what is going on
C) This may be a warning sign for dementia
D) Our measures have low validity

Please select the correct answer.

Bu is often late for appointments but says it's because she had more important things on her mind. This is an example of which coping strategy?

A) Immunization
B) Accommodation
C) Avoidance
D) Assimilation

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following is most strongly associated with loss of bone density?

A) Genetic factors
B) Lifestyle factors like not exercising
C) Hormonal factors such as loss of estrogen
D) Cohort factors

Please select the correct answer.

That super sweet iced tea that your grandmother gives you might be that way because she

A) Has lost a lot of sweet taste buds and cannot taste sweetness as well anymore
B) Is a member of that cohort that really enjoys sweets
C) Is trying to get you to be a little sweeter than you have been in the past
D) Has experienced damage in her parietal lobe where sweet sensations are directed

A shortage of these two vitamins can produce symptoms that mimic dementia:

A) A and C
B) B6 and B12
C) B6 and D
D) B12 and E

Which of the following is one of McAdam's levels of personality?

B) Identity
C) Generativity
D) Assimilation

A) Moderate amounts of alcohol
B) Social support
C) Good genes
D) Avoiding stress

A) A first step toward eventual marriage
B) An alternative to marriage

D) Their swan song

B) It's much harder to move when you're older

High levels of self-care behaviors have been associated with high levels of

A) Neuroticism
B) Extraversion

D) Secondary control

B) A smaller proportion of older women report dreams about sex

D) A higher proportion of older men and women are victims of cancer

Fear of aging has been associated with high levels of

A) Introversion
B) Neuroticism
C) Rigidity
D) Mid-life crisis

In which dementia are cognitive symptoms less likely?

B) Pick's

D) NeuroAIDS

A) Stay in school
B) Eat the right foods

When your sister Patricia was feeling depressed, you comforted her and reminisced about happier times. You provided which type of social support?

A) Emotional
B) Instrumental
C) Informational
D) Friendly

Hearing loss occurs more frequently for

A) Men than women
B) Women than men

B) Suppression of the immune system

A) Coping strategies
B) Work productivity

A) Stay away from other people for a while
B) Get out and be active

Social support is most likely to have a positive influence on health and well being when it is

A) Very emotional
B) Perceived as support

D) External rather than internal

Free radicals are produced by

B) Excess consumption of Vitamins A and C

B) Oldism

A) Euthanasia
B) Cryonics

Loss of smell for adults 80 and older is

B) Very frequent (more than 75%)

Projective tests generally ___ than objective tests of personality.

B) Are more visual
C) Are more valid

Cells in the eye that respond to low levels of illumination are called

A) Rods

A) Positive ones are stronger

D) Older adults drink more herbal tea than do younger adults

Please select the correct answer.

The initials ADL stand for

A) Activities of Daily Living
B) American Disease Legion
C) Always Delay Learning
D) Ancient Dependent Ladies

Please select the correct answer.

The dementia that results from a long-term deficiency of thiamine is one type of ____ dementia

A) Alzheimer's
B) Korsakoff's
C) Creutzfeldt-Jakob
D) Lewy body

Please select the correct answer.

The initial length of telomere stand for members of a species is

A) Always the same
B) Determined genetically
C) Dependent upon climate and time of year at birth
D) Determined by parent diet and exercise

Please select the correct answer.

The current record for longest lived human being is held by

A) Jeanne Calment
B) Maggie Kuhn
C) Maria Esther de Capovilla
D) M. Cherie Clark

Please select the correct answer.

Glaucoma refers to the condition in which

A) Fluid pressure in the eye is above normal
B) Inner and outer layers of the retina separate
C) The lens becomes cloudy and opaque
D) The central part of the retina no longer functions

Please select the correct answer.

Workers in which of the following jobs still have mandatory retirements once they reach a certain age?

A) Cab drivers
B) Fire fighters
C) Insurance regulators
D) Computer programmers

Please select the correct answer.

Validation therapy refers to treatments in which the person with dementia

A) Is carefully monitored day and night
B) Is treated like a fellow human being
C) Is left alone to die peacefully
D) Is given double or triple doses of medication

Please select the correct answer.

Surveys of bereaved individuals have found that one of the things that is reported as being most helpful is when others

A) Avoid any discussion of the deceased
B) Remain in close contact
C) Stay away and let the person grieve
D) Change the home environment for the bereaved

Please select the correct answer.

An example of a gain, rather than a loss, that occurs as we grow older is our gain in

A) Perspective
B) Quickness
C) Size of our social networks
D) Certainty

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following appears to remain relatively stable over the adult years?

A) Sensory memories
B) Personal concerns
C) Marital strain
D) Job satisfaction

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following is always the longest?

A) Life expectancy at birth (LEAB)
B) Life span
C) Life expectancy at a specified age (LEASA)
D) There is no way of knowing

Please select the correct answer.

Of the following, which is the more frequent stereotype of older adults?

A) Full of wisdom and knowledge
B) Healthy and independent
C) Confused and disoriented
D) Sleepy and lazy

Please select the correct answer.

One reason that older adults may have difficulty in retrieving memories is that

A) Long-term memory often discards older and unused memories
B) There are many more memories to search through to find the one that is sought
C) Older adults quit searching because they have more important things to do
D) Memory is less well organized as we grow older and finding a memory can be quite difficult

Please select the correct answer.

Even a small amount of sleep deprivation seems to

A) Increase weight
B) Improve sleep quality
C) Disrupt attention the next day
D) Increase irritability

Please select the correct answer.

NEAT may be one way in which some people are able to maintain a healthy BMI; NEAT refers to

A) Eating the right kinds of low calorie foods
B) Daily activities like walking, gesturing, and even fidgeting
C) Intense aerobic exercise practiced at least 3 times a week
D) Surgical removal of fatty tissue

Please select the correct answer.

Over the last decade or two, which of the following causes of death has shown a huge increase?

A) Alzheimer's
B) Cancer
C) Cardiovascular diseases
D) Homicide

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following statements is TRUE concerning older workers' job performance?

A) Older workers always perform better because of their vast experience
B) Older workers never perform better than younger workers because with age, a worker's skills decline.
C) Job performance for older workers depends both upon the decline of skills and the benefits of experience
D) Most jobs are performed better by younger adults but a few are performed better by older adults

Please select the correct answer.

Older adults' negative beliefs about their own memories seem to be more influenced by _____ than by their actual performance on memory tests

A) Negative stereotypes about older memory
B) Time of day and weather conditions
C) Who they are speaking with
D) Their slower processing speed

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following is NOT one of the more frequently named activities by those who are retired?

A) Volunteering
B) Travel
C) Redoing the home
D) Household chores

Please select the correct answer.

The retirement phase that occurs least frequently is the ____ phase

A) Disenchantment
B) Honeymoon
C) Retirement routine
D) Preretirement

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following is the most important variable for gerontological researchers?

A) Age
B) Gender
C) Cohort
D) Time of measurement

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following does NOT increase the risk of falling?

A) Taking many prescription medications
B) Visual impairment
C) Having no emotional support
D) A change in walking style or gait

Please select the correct answer.

The main reason given by men and women for their long lasting marriage is that

A) They are best friends
B) They must fulfill their vows
C) They agree on almost everything
D) They owe it to their children

Please select the correct answer.

An older adult who has received a message (e.g., it's going to rain tomorrow) would be most likely to remember what when telling another person?

A) The person who told them it would rain
B) Where they were when they received the message

The lifespan perspective says that development is composed of gains and losses; this means that

A) We gain while we are younger but lose when we are older
B) We gain some things and lose others at every age
C) For every aspect of development there is no overall change since each gain is offset by loss
D) Gains are far more important than losses but losses occur too

Please select the correct answer.

Identity refers to one's

A) Use of a particular coping strategy
B) Control over one's own life story
C) Physical appearance and overall personality
D) Coherent sense of self

Please select the correct answer.

Current estimates of how many people exercise on a regular basis suggest that _____ do

A) Less than 50%
B) More than 75%
C) Less than 25%
D) More than 50%

Please select the correct answer.

An increased frequency of urination in older adults is most likely caused by

A) Prostate cancer
B) Smaller bladder
C) Kidney problems
D) Gall stone(s)

Please select the correct answer.

Some research has found that later cognitive decline is predicted by earlier

A) Cardiovascular problems
B) Loss of muscle strength
C) Immune system decline
D) Graying of hair

The law that requires all healthcare institutions that receive Medicaid funds to inform patients about advance directives is called the

A) Patient Self-Determination Act
B) Informed Consent Act
C) Advance Directive
D) Medicaid Directive Information Act

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following is NOT among the top 10 causes of death in the U. S.?

A) Kidney diseases
B) AIDS
C) Septicemia
D) Accidents

Please select the correct answer.

Presbyopia refers to

A) The point of clearest vision moving closer to the eye
B) The decline in vision with advanced age
C) The loss of hearing for higher pitch as one grows older
D) The point of clearest vision moving farther from the eye

Please select the correct answer.

The design of products and environments to fit the capabilities of people who use them or live there is called _____ design

B) Ecological
C) Ergonomic
D) Eclectic

Please select the correct answer.

The insurance program for poor people of all ages is called

A) Hospice
B) Medicaid
C) Medicare
D) Respite

Please select the correct answer.

When damage to the brain is irreversible and increasing we refer to the disorder as

A) Delirium
B) MCI
C) Dementia
D) Pick's

Please select the correct answer.

Grandparents with grandchildren in college report feeling especially loved when such grandchildren

A) Ask about their satisfaction with life and offer to help
B) Visit during the holidays and bring gifts
C) Pay a surprise visit and ask for advice
D) Invite the grandparents over to their place and cook a good meal

Please select the correct answer.

The influence of genetics on longevity is estimated to be about

A) 20%
B) 33%
C) 50%
D) 75%

Older adults are most likely to be involved in a traffic accident when they are

A) On foot
B) Driving in a new location

D) Alone

Life stories are more likely for people who have a sense of

A) Well being
B) Personal control
C) Generativity
D) Humor

The idea that the ability to complete a task depends on the fit between the environment and the person undertaking the task is a basic tenet of which of the following theories of aging?

B) Ecological
C) Fitness
D) Congruence

Please select the correct answer.

Neuroticism has been found to be correlated with which of the following?

B) Apathy and indifference
C) Deceit and cunning
D) Mania and hypertension

Please select the correct answer.

The Apo-E 2 protein is very prevalent in people who

A) Die young
B) Live to be 100 or older
C) Have healthy immune systems
D) Also have high levels of Apo-E 4

Information coming into our cognitive system is thought to first enter a

A) Sensory memory
B) Perceptual processor
C) Working memory
D) Meta-memory

Omega 3 appears to reduce the risk of

A) Some cancers
B) Cardiovascular disease
C) Arthritis
D) Insomnia

Please select the correct answer.

The term "senescence" refers to

A) An increased vulnerability
B) The process of becoming older
C) The loss of mental abilities
D) Biological aging

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following is caused by a prion?

A) Vascular dementia
B) Alzheimer's
C) Creutzfeldt-Jakob
D) Huntington's

Please select the correct answer.

A difference between the social networks of older and younger adults is that older adults have

A) Larger inner circles
B) Larger outer circles
C) Smaller inner circles
D) Smaller outer circles

Please select the correct answer.

The first person to measure and compare the response times of young and old was

A) Francis Galton
B) William James
C) Michelle Meer
D) Tom Penge

Please select the correct answer.

About what percentage of people who have had bridge jobs say it was better than their career job?

A) Less than 25%
B) Less than 50%
C) More than 50%

Please select the correct answer.

We want our measures to be as reliable as possible; reliability refers to

A) Whether our measure really measure anything at all
B) Whether our measure is really measuring what it claims to measure
C) Whether our measure is consistent in the information it provides
D) Whether our measure has or has not been used before

Please select the correct answer.

A problem in comparing older adults' memory for recent events and events that happened a long time ago is that recent events

A) May be very well rehearsed
B) Are far more meaningful
C) Have no denominator to help in computing an average

Of the following types of memory, which shows the biggest deficit with advanced age?

B) Episodic memory

A) Radiation from anti-oxidants
B) Metabolic processes
C) Free radicals and sunlight
D) Telomerase

Please select the correct answer.

Comorbidity is a problem for older adults because it

A) Makes correct diagnoses difficult
B) Increases funeral costs

Please select the correct answer.

With respect to theories of senescence, it's probably safe to say that

A) Programmed theories are the best we have at present
B) Many theories will have to be combined to explain senescence
C) The evidence for these theories is direct and quickly accumulating

Current life expectancy in the United States is about

A) 78
B) 82
C) 68
D) 75

Please select the correct answer.

A burial site where the body is allowed to decompose naturally without a casket is called a _____ cemetery

B) Green
C) Rapid decay
D) Sunshine

Older adults with higher education and self-esteem are more likely to be

A) Sexually active
B) Socially isolated
C) Lonely as they grow older
D) Married for a long time

Please select the correct answer.

BMI is regarded as a better measure of health than weight by itself because BMI is based on weight and

A) Height
B) Bone structure
C) Immune Function
D) Diet and exercise

Please select the correct answer.

Morbidity refers to

A) Death
B) Social and emotional isolation
C) Increased disability and declining health
D) A period of intense personal loss

Please select the correct answer.

Older adults are able to improve their memories and reduce their anxiety about declining memory when

B) They simply learn a number of memory improvement techniques
C) They learn that many aspects of memory do not decline and some even get better
D) Older adults cannot do either of these

Please select the correct answer.

Hearing loss for higher pitch is referred to as

A) Presbyopia
B) Presbycusis
C) Pitch deafness
D) Conductive loss

Please select the correct answer.

In this chapter's Senior View, Tolly Kleckley told us that personality

A) Changes a lot past age 50
B) Doesn't change past age 50

The Kingbergs give us several keys to successful aging; which of the following is one that they did not name?

A) Eat the correct food but not too much.
B) Respect each other
C) Party at least once a month
D) Make long-range plans

Please select the correct answer.

Those who have lost a close family member to suicide most often experience

A) A lack of support from others
B) A desire to kill themselves
C) Feelings of relief and release
D) Severe but temporary cognitive impairment

Please select the correct answer.

Our bodies have a natural, built in defense against free radicals that is referred to as

A) AFR
B) SOD
C) Vitamin C
D) Telomerase

Please select the correct answer.

Open-ended questions on a survey often make it difficult to

A) Get people to fill the survey out

D) Get anyone to believe your results

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following groups is likely to have the more positive view of aging and older adults?

B) Children younger than 10
C) Young adults
D) Adolescents

Please select the correct answer.

The paradox of well-being refers to the finding of high levels of happiness among

B) Older adults
C) People with very low SES

Please select the correct answer.

A) A loss of resources and slower processing speed
B) An increase in the inhibition of relevant information
C) A general decline in the ability to process information
D) A severe loss of neural connections and decreased blood flow

Please select the correct answer.

A disadvantage of institutional care is that the staff frequently teach older residents to be

A) Rude
B) Dependent
C) Independent
D) Selfish

Please select the correct answer.

If you believe that we are mostly in control of our own development and that our behaviors, good or bad, determine how successful our aging with be, you would be said to have which of the following perspectives?

A) Organismic
B) Nurture
C) Continuity
D) Mechanistic

Please select the correct answer.

The age at which one can receive full benefits from social security

A) Is 62
B) Is 65
C) Has been increasing
D) Will never change

Please select the correct answer.

Loss of stomach lining can lead to symptoms that resemble

A) Anorexia
B) Dementia
C) Senescence
D) Hepatitis

Please select the correct answer.

Which of the following has NOT been shown to be an effective treatment for depression in older adults?

A) Rigorous exercise
B) Life review
C) Mental stimulation
D) Anti-depressant drugs

Please select the correct answer.

The term Baby Boom Generation refers to people who

A) Were born before WW II
B) Have had an extraordinary number of offspring
C) Were born right after WW II
D) Have raised their children in small villages

Please select the correct answer.

Older workers are more likely to

A) Be absent from work
B) Be dissatisfied with their jobs
C) Be less productive
D) Be laid off

Please select the correct answer.

Mabel Davis, in this chapter's Senior View, would agree with which of the following?

A) Time seems to speed up when you grow older
B) Exercise keeps your mind sharp
C) Women are tougher than men
D) Glasses and hearing aids should be avoided

Please select the correct answer.

The information stored in memory, according to research and our Senior View interviewees, is

A) True to life
B) Our own interpretation
C) Always exaggerated
D) Never accurate

Please select the correct answer.

When speaking with an older adults with some hearing loss, you should

A) Speak a little slower than normal

C) Face them so they can watch your lips

Please select the correct answer.

Longevity is strongly associated with higher levels of

A) Social support
B) BMI
C) Alcohol use
D) Supplement use

Please select the correct answer.

The hypothesis that says adults will remain healthy until very old age and then quickly become ill and die is the ____ hypothesis

A) Terminal drop
B) Compression of morbidity
C) Klagmore-Rensfeldt
D) Decline avoidance

Please select the correct answer.

The woman who conducted a longitudinal study on herself and found increased retrieval difficulty as she got older was named

A) Clark
B) Smith
C) Whitebear
D) Ebbinghaus

Please select the correct answer.
